Repeal of Decision on Troop Dispatch to Iraq Demanded 
    Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- More than 260 members of seven youth organizations including the south Korean Council of Youth Organizations, the Solidarity of Youth and Students for Implementing the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and the Christian Youth Federation reportedly held a press conference in front of the Myongdong Cathedral on May 20 and made public a youth declaration of the withdrawal of the decision on the troop dispatch to Iraq.
 The last one year after the U.S. occupied Iraq was days of brutality and massacre and violence against POWs was a series of disgusting tortures and maltreatment, more dreadful than death, the declaration said, adding: We can never send our youths to the U.S. war of aggression in Iraq.    
 The declaration strongly demanded that the government and the 17th National Assembly retract the decision on the troop dispatch to Iraq at an early date.
